article.description: McNeese St. 84, SW Assemblies of God 66
article.headline: McNeese St. 84, SW Assemblies of God 66
article.linkText: McNeese St. 84, SW Assemblies of God 66
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. -- Patrick Richard scored 21 points and had five steals as McNeese State remained unbeaten at home with an 84-66 victory over Southwestern Assemblies of God on Monday night. Dontae Cannon scored 10 points and P.J. Alawoya had 13 rebounds for the Cowboys (6-3), whose six wins have come at home and their three losses on the road. Ronald Horne, Nathaniel Ward and Ryan Russ all scored 15 points for the Lions, an NAIA team, who led 14-13 after Horne's jumper with 9:36 left in the first half. McNeese State then went on a 17-5 run to lead 30-19. It was 37-28 at halftime, and the Cowboys widened their lead to as many as 20 points in the second half. All 13 of their players got into the game. McNeese State took advantage of a big edge in turnovers. The Lions committed 26 to just eight by the Cowboys.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
